Text: Re Following UpNonPrivilegedpst I spoke with this guy at Iron the company the sells MV MVWebb may be what we need He says it costs about k but we may be able to get CSC to pitch inthey also have some load forecasting toolssee below Sorry about our meetingI will try to set one up tomorrow if things go as planned tonight Maurice Brandon Force Brandon troncom on AM To cc Subject Following Up Maurice Here is the MVWEB demo website information as requested I have also enclosed some brief white papers on other solutions from Itron EIS Again I will be going through Houston next week and could visit your site either Wed or Friday to discuss any of these software solutions Please let me know if I can answer any other questions for you Thank you for your time and consideration No www User ID demo PW mdem zero Brandon Force Regional Account Manager Itron Energy Information Systems Raleigh NC Voice x Fax Email MVEEdoc MVWEB Brochuredoc MVSTAR Brochuredoc MVPBS Brochuredoc MVEEdoc MVWEB Brochuredoc MVSTAR Brochuredoc MVPBS Brochuredoc

Todays pm mtngNonPrivilegedpst Gentlemen I have been pulled into an emergency task force this morning by Evan Hughes to address some CA issues for which you are probably aware Therefore I must reschedule our meeting for tomorrow afternoon or Friday I would like to try pm on Thurs What are your schedules looking like

Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Cc NonPrivilegedpst Neil Pat is meeting with the CAISO auditors all afternoon but I have asked if she can give us some time after pm If she is not available what time tommorow morning is good for you Chris and Micheal Also I have attached the CSC systems drawing that I spoke of in our last meeting Maurice Enron Energy Services From Neil Bresnan AM To Michael ES cc Maurice ES Chris nronXgate Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Maurice I have PRC Monday If we have the meeting with Pat at PM I should be able to make it Please send me an email to confirm the time and location NFB Michael Frazier PM To Maurice ES cc Neil ES Chris nronXgate Gregg ES James ES Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Sounds like a feasible solution to me as long as we can get specified formats and the data uploads are wellmaintained by CSC Are there any extra costs on their end for performing this posting function mrf Maurice Winter AM To Neil ES Chris nronXgate Michael ES cc Gregg ES James ES Subject Load Forecasting access to MV interval data All I spoke with Pat Priestley this morning about our request to get access to the MV daily interval meter data for load forecasting She said that she would not be available to meet formally until Monday due to the declared disaster at their operations due to the flood She said they are moving back to the Pennzoil building today and Friday so things should be close to normal by Monday Pat said that it is not be a problem to export the MV data in just about any format on a daily basis for us The data is housed in MV databases which according to Pat can only be read by an MV system so we would need to purchase MV very expensive if we wanted to read the data directly I suggest we get the data exported daily from CSC to an FTP site at Enron because they can manage the process on a daily basis We can sweep the FTP site daily and have it automatically imported into our databases If we are in agreement with this solution I will create an emergency work request with CSC to begin working on this immediately Maurice Embedded StdOleLink Embedded StdOleLink

Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Cc NonPrivilegedpst All I spoke with Pat Priestley this morning about our request to get access to the MV daily interval meter data for load forecasting She said that she would not be available to meet formally until Monday due to the declared disaster at their operations due to the flood She said they are moving back to the Pennzoil building today and Friday so things should be close to normal by Monday Pat said that it is not be a problem to export the MV data in just about any format on a daily basis for us The data is housed in MV databases which according to Pat can only be read by an MV system so we would need to purchase MV very expensive if we wanted to read the data directly I suggest we get the data exported daily from CSC to an FTP site at Enron because they can manage the process on a daily basis We can sweep the FTP site daily and have it automatically imported into our databases If we are in agreement with this solution I will create an emergency work request with CSC to begin working on this immediately Maurice
